Title: Cortical efferents of the entorhinal cortex and the adjacent parahippocampal region in the monkey (Macaca fascicularis)
Abstract: "Entorhinal cortex (EC) relays information from the hippocampus to the cerebral cortex. The origin of this entorhino-cortical pathway was studied semiquantitatively and topographically with the use of 23 retrograde tracer injections in cortical areas of the frontal, temporal, and parietal lobes of the monkey. To assess possible alternative, parallel pathways, the parahippocampal region, comprised of temporal pole (TP), perirhinal (PRC), and posterior parahippocampal cortices (PPH), was included in the study. The majority of the cortical areas receive convergent projections from EC and the parahippocampal region. Strong EC layer V output is directed to temporal pole, medial frontal and orbitofrontal cortices, and the rostral part of the polysensory area of the superior temporal sulcus (sts). Moderate EC output is directed to the caudal superior temporal gyrus, area TE, and parietal cortex, and little to none to the lateral frontal cortex. With the exception of the projection to the medial frontal cortex, output from TP, PRC, and PPH surpassed that from EC, although with regional differences. TP layers II–III, V–VI project strongly to all areas injected except parietal cortex and caudal superior temporal gyrus, while PRC layers III/V–VI send strong projections to rostral parts of area TE and sts. PPH layers III/V–VI project heavily to parietal cortex and caudal superior temporal gyrus. These results suggest that the medial temporal output is primarily organized hierarchically, but at the same time, it has multiple exits of information. These parallel, alternative routes may influence local circuitry in the cerebral cortex and participate in the consolidation of declarative memory."

@BrainMaps_Delineation.Citation: "First, we did not demarcate the mediolateral subdivisions of area 36 and therefore we used 36r and 36c, which include 36rm−36rl, and 36cm−36cl, respectively; second, we found an increasing layer IV in area TH caudally, and therefore we used the term THc to differentiate this region from the more rostral portion, THr, where layer IV is almost absent."
@BrainMaps_Delineation.Comments: No methods are described how the parcellation is made

@Injections.Citation: "Tracer injections in medial frontal cortex can be seen in Fig. 2 and in Table 1. Two injections were placed in area 24 of the anterior cingulate cortex (M6DY, M6FB) and two injections were located in area 32 of the prelimbic cortex (M7FB, M7DY)."
@Injections.Comments: Injection is made in caudal part of area, Case M7FB

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "All injections labelled neurons in layers V and VI of EC subdivisions ER and ELr, and exclusively in layer V of the medial two-thirds of EI, EC, and the medial one-third of ECL. With the exception of the caudal injection in area 24 (M6DY), all injections yielded dense retrograde label in TP areas 36pm and 36pl. Label in areas 36pm and 36pl tended to form relatively large bands located principally in layers V, VI, and III (Figs 3A and 4) that continued in the anterior two-thirds of area 35 (layers V and VI). Label density in area 35 was particularly high after injections in caudal parts of areas 32 and 24 (M6DY and M7FB, respectively, Fig. 4C and D) and more moderate after rostral injections in areas 24 and 32 (M6FB and M7DY, shown in Fig. 4A and B). All the experiments resulted in light density of retrogradely labelled neurons in areas 36r and 36c (layers V and VI). reas TH and TF of PPH had a high density of retrogradely labelled cells, especially after caudal injections in areas 24 and 32. Labelled neurons were heavily concentrated at mid-mediolateral levels of PPH. Label in areas TH and TF was found in layer V, and to a less extent in layer III (Figs 3G–I and 4).  In summary, EC, rostral area 35, and areas TH and TFm had a high density of retrogradely labelled cells in the experiments with the caudal injections in areas 24 and 32 (i.e. closer to the genu of the corpus callosum), while TP areas 36pm and 36pl contained higher density of label after the rostral injections (compare panels A and B with C and D in Fig. 4). Table 2 presents the percentage of retrogradely labelled neurons found in EC, TP, PRC, and PPH architectonic divisions in this experimental group, which is summarized in Fig. 12."

@Injections.Citation: "Tracer injections in medial frontal cortex can be seen in Fig. 2 and in Table 1. Two injections were placed in area 24 of the anterior cingulate cortex (M6DY, M6FB) and two injections were located in area 32 of the prelimbic cortex (M7FB, M7DY)."
@Injections.Comments: Injection is made in rostral part of the area, Case M6FB

Label density in area 35 was particularly high after injections in caudal parts of areas 32 and 24 (M6DY and M7FB, respectively, Fig. 4C and D) and more moderate after rostral injections in areas 24 and 32 (M6FB and M7DY, shown in Fig. 4A and B). All the experiments resulted in light density of retrogradely labelled neurons in areas 36r and 36c (layers V and VI).Areas TH and TF of PPH had a high density of retrogradely labelled cells, especially after caudal injections in areas 24 and 32. Labelled neurons were heavily concentrated at mid-mediolateral levels of PPH. Label in areas TH and TF was found in layer V, and to a less extent in layer III (Figs 3G–I and 4).  In summary, EC, rostral area 35, and areas TH and TFm had a high density of retrogradely labelled cells in the experiments with the caudal injections in areas 24 and 32 (i.e. closer to the genu of the corpus callosum), while TP areas 36pm and 36pl contained higher density of label after the rostral injections (compare panels A and B with C and D in Fig. 4). Table 2 presents the percentage of retrogradely labelled neurons found in EC, TP, PRC, and PPH architectonic divisions in this experimental group, which is summarized in Fig. 12."

@Injections.Citation: "Tracer injections (Fig. 2 and Table 1) were placed on area 45 (M5DY), ventral area 12 (M5FB), and at different levels of area 46 (M10FB, M10DY, and M4DY)."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "This experimental group was characterized by an almost complete absence of retrogradely labelled cells in the medial temporal cortex. Only a few labelled neurons (a total of three) were found in the lateral entorhinal divisions ELc and ELr. Neither PRC nor PPH showed, other than very occasionally, labelled neurons. The percentage of labelled cells in this group is represented in Table 2. We wish to point out that the percentage of retrogradely labelled neurons cannot be directly compared to other injection sites, and therefore it is only shown in Table 2 and not in the summary Fig. 12."

@Injections.Citation: "The rostralmost injection in the temporal cortex was situated in area 36pm of the temporal pole (M15FB, see Table 1 and Fig. 2)"

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "This injection labelled cells in virtually the complete extension of EC. The highest density of retrogradely labelled cells was observed in the lateral portions of EC rostral divisions (EO, ER, ELr, EI) and in the medial portions of its caudal divisions (ELc, EC, ECL) (Fig. 7C–F). Similarly to the results obtained in cases with injections in medial frontal cortex, retrogradely labelled neurons in this case, were found primarily in layers V–VI rostrally (Fig. 7C–D), while at intermediate and caudal levels they were almost exclusively in layer V (Fig. 7E–F). Retrograde label in TP was dense, although occupied primarily the dorsal portions of areas 36pm and 36pl (Fig. 7A). Labelling in TP continued in layers III and V–VI of the rostralmost portion of areas 35 and 36r (Fig. 7, compare B and C, see two-dimensional map in Fig. 8A). PPH presented abundant retrograde labelling rostrally throughout its mediolateral extent, including both areas TH and TF (Fig. 7H). Label remained in the lateral division of area TF caudally (TFl, layers V and III, Fig. 7I). Area TH presented lower density of label compared to TF, and it was concentrated in layer V of THr (Fig. 7I, see two-dimensional map in Fig. 8A)."
@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Comments: The precentage of labelling in area 36pl was dedicated to be 5,9 in table 2, which is probably a typing error, because it does not fit the rest of the table or text or figures. We took it as 55.9, because that fits to the rest.

@Injections.Citation: "The superior temporal gyrus (STG) had four injections, three located rostrally and one caudally (Table 1 and Fig. 2)"
@Injections.Comments: Injection was made posterior in area, Case M13FB

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "The experiment with the next (more posterior) injection in sts (M13FB) yielded a high density of retrogradely labelled cells in EC. Layers V and VI of the rostral one-third of EC (ER, ELr, ELc, EI) presented labelled neurons along the whole mediolateral axis, while they tended to be located more laterally in layer V of its caudal divisions (EC, ECl, Fig. 8C). The caudal one-third of areas 36pm and 36pl of TP contained a high density of retrogradely labelled cells (layers III, V and VI), which continued in area 35 (V and VI). Layers V and VI and, to a less extent layer III, in areas 36r and 36c had a high density of retrogradely labelled neurons, which formed two patches; one in the rostral portion of area 36r and a second one caudally in area 36r that continued with the label in area 36c. PPH had abundant retrogradely labelled neurons (layers III, V, and VI) mostly at rostral and midportions of areas TH and TF (Fig. 9C)."

@Injections.Citation: "The superior temporal gyrus (STG) had four injections, three located rostrally and one caudally (Table 1 and Fig. 2)."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "A more posterior injection in the rostral portion of the polysensory area of sts (M12FB) resulted in fewer retrogradely labelled neurons in EC, PRC, and PPH. Labelled neurons were found mostly in layer V of the lateral (ELr, ELc) and caudal (EC) divisions of entorhinal cortex (Fig. 8D). A high density of retrogradely labelled neurons was observed in areas 36pl and 36pm (layers II, V and VI). Moderate to light density of label was found in area 35 in layers V and VI and, to a lesser extent, in layer III. Only area TFl of PPH had retrogradely labelled neurons and they were located in layers III, V, and VI (Fig. 8D)."

@Injections.Citation: "The superior temporal gyrus (STG) had four injections, three located rostrally and one caudally (Table 1 and Fig. 2)."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Retrograde labelling in EC decreased dramatically (i.e. only two labelled neurons) compared to more rostral injections. TP contained only scattered labelled neurons, mainly in area 36pl. Only layers V and VI of areas TH, TFm, and to a lesser extent, area TFl displayed retrogradely labelled neurons (Fig. 8E)."

@Injections.Citation: "Tracer injections were located in somatosensory association area 5 (M3DY) and at different rostrocaudal and mediolateral levels of the inferior parietal lobe area 7 (M3FB, M2DY, and M2FB) (Fig. 2 and Table 1)."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Injections located more ventrally in area 7 resulted in an overall higher density of label compared to more dorsal injections (Fig. 11A–C). The distribution of retrogradely labelled neurons in a representative case (M2FB) can be seen in Fig. 10. In all cases, EC displayed neuronal labelling in layer V, where it formed a band of label located caudal and lateral (from EI to ECL). Areas 36pm and 36pl of the temporal pole contained a moderate to low density of labelled neurons in cases with the most ventrally placed injections in area 7 (M3FB and M2FB, Fig. 10A). PRC displayed low density of labelled cells in layers V and VI of the caudal portion of areas 35, 36r, and 36c (Fig. 11A and B). Both the amount and the mediolateral extent of the neuronal labelling increased in layer V of area 36c (see two-dimensional map in Fig. 11A and B). In contrast, areas TFl and THc of PPH had heavy labelling after injections in area 7. The highest density of retrograde label was found in layers V and VI, and to a lesser extent in layer III of area TFl, although TFm also displayed labelled neurons (mostly in layer V). Retrograde label was comparatively much lower in area TH. Labelled neurons were found primarily in layer V of area THc."

@Injections.Citation: "njections located in the caudal half of area 13 (M9FB and M9DY) and in the caudal orbitofrontal portion of area 12 (M8FB) were available for this study (Table 1 and Fig. 2)."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Retrogradely labelled neurons were found in the rostral half of EC divisions EO, ELr, ER (Fig. 5D–F) and to a lesser extent in EI, ELc, and EC. The laminar origin was mostly in layers V and VI, almost equally in number (Fig. 5D–E).  Areas 36pm and 36pl presented dense patches of retrogradely labelled neurons distributed through layers V, VI, and III (Fig. 5A–C). PRC contained abundant retrogradely labelled neurons in the rostral portion of areas 35 and 36r, whereas labelling was almost absent at more caudal levels. PPH presented labelled neurons in layers V and III of the rostral part of area TFl (Fig. 5G–I).  Two-dimensional maps in Fig. 6 show the high density of labelled neurons found in rostral EC and TP areas 36pl and 36pm. A lower density of retrogradely labelled neurons were seen in the rostral portions of areas 35 and 36r and in rostral PPH. Table 2 presents the percentage of retrogradely labelled neurons in the subdivisions of the EC, PRC, and PPH, which have been summarized in Fig. 12."

@Injections.Citation: "Tracer injections (Fig. 2 and Table 1) were placed on area 45 (M5DY), ventral area 12 (M5FB), and at different levels of area 46 (M10FB, M10DY, and M4DY); Injections located in the caudal half of area 13 (M9FB and M9DY) and in the caudal orbitofrontal portion of area 12 (M8FB) were available for this study (Table 1 and Fig. 2). "
@Injections.Comments: Injection was made in caudal orbitofrontal part of area, Cases M5FB and M8FB

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Two-dimensional maps in Fig. 6 show the high density of labelled neurons found in rostral EC and TP areas 36pl and 36pm. A lower density of retrogradely labelled neurons were seen in the rostral portions of areas 35 and 36r and in rostral PPH. Table 2 presents the percentage of retrogradely labelled neurons in the subdivisions of the EC, PRC, and PPH, which have been summarized in Fig. 12."

@Injections.Comments: Injection was made ventral part of area, Case M5FB

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Comments: No labeling was detected in this case

@Injections.Citation: "The superior temporal gyrus (STG) had four injections, three located rostrally and one caudally (Table 1 and Fig. 2). One injection was at the most anterior portion of the superior temporal gyrus (M12DY, STGr of Insausti et al. 1987)."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "This injection (M12DY) labelled neurons laterally in rostral portions of EC (ELr, ELc, Fig. 9D–F) and more medially at caudal levels (Fig. 9G). Both rostral and caudal extremes of EC (EO and ECL, respectively) presented fewer retrogradely labelled neurons (see Fig. 9C and H). Retrogradely labelled neurons in EC were found in layer VI rostrally, whereas at more caudal levels appeared exclusively in layer V.The dorsal portion of TP areas 36pm and 36pl showed a high density of retrograde label, which was found throughout layers II–III and V–VI (Fig. 9A). Label in the temporal pole continued as far as the rostral one-third of area 35 (layers III, IV, and VI), and decreased in area 35 at the level of the rostral entorhinal division (ER) (Fig. 9). Areas 36r and 36c contained light density of label, which is best illustrated in Fig. 9B. The rostral two-thirds of areas TH and TF of PPH had dense retrograde label principally concentrated in layers III, V and VI of area TFl (Fig. 9I). Percentage of labelled neurons is show in Table 2 and summarized in Fig. 12.  The experiment with the next (more posterior) injection in sts (M13FB) yielded a high density of retrogradely labelled cells in EC. Layers V and VI of the rostral one-third of EC (ER, ELr, ELc, EI) presented labelled neurons along the whole mediolateral axis, while they tended to be located more laterally in layer V of its caudal divisions (EC, ECl, Fig. 8C). The caudal one-third of areas 36pm and 36pl of TP contained a high density of retrogradely labelled cells (layers III, V and VI), which continued in area 35 (V and VI). Layers V and VI and, to a less extent layer III, in areas 36r and 36c had a high density of retrogradely labelled neurons, which formed two patches; one in the rostral portion of area 36r and a second one caudally in area 36r that continued with the label in area 36c. PPH had abundant retrogradely labelled neurons (layers III, V, and VI) mostly at rostral and midportions of areas TH and TF (Fig. 9C).  A more posterior injection in the rostral portion of the polysensory area of sts (M12FB) resulted in fewer retrogradely labelled neurons in EC, PRC, and PPH. Labelled neurons were found mostly in layer V of the lateral (ELr, ELc) and caudal (EC) divisions of entorhinal cortex (Fig. 8D). A high density of retrogradely labelled neurons was observed in areas 36pl and 36pm (layers II, V and VI). Moderate to light density of label was found in area 35 in layers V and VI and, to a lesser extent, in layer III. Only area TFl of PPH had retrogradely labelled neurons and they were located in layers III, V, and VI (Fig. 8D)."

@Injections.Citation: "The injection in case M15DY was situated at the rostral extreme of area TE (area TE1 of Seltzer & Pandya, 1978), a transitional area with 36r of the PRC."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "The rostral injection in area TE (M15DY) labelled neurons principally in the entorhinal lateral division (ELr) that extended somewhat to its rostral divisions EO and ER. Ventral portions of areas 36pm and 36pl (layers II, V, and VI) contained a high density of retrograde label that continued in the rostral third of area 36r (largely in layers V and VI, but also in layer III and more scarcely in layer II) that ended rather abruptly, and it did not continue caudally into area 36c. High to moderate retrograde label was also found in layers V and VI of the rostral half of area 35. Area TH contained a few labelled neurons in layers V, VI, and, to a lesser extent, in layer III (Fig. 8F)."

@Injections.Citation: "The second injection in area TE (M11DY) was located more caudally, at the border between areas TE2 and TEm of Seltzer & Pandya (1978)."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "The injection located at more caudal and dorsal levels in area TE (M11DY) yielded no labelled neurons in EC or in areas 36pm and 36pl. In comparison with the rostral injection in area TE (M15DY), area 36r of the PRC showed a more moderate density of labelling (compare Fig. 8F and G). The caudal two-thirds of areas TH and TF of PPH had a higher density of retrogradely labelled neurons than those found after the rostral injection (Fig. 8G)."

@Injections.Citation: "Tracer injections were located in somatosensory association area 5 (M3DY) and at different rostrocaudal and mediolateral levels of the inferior parietal lobe area 7 (M3FB, M2DY, and M2FB) (Fig. 2 and Table 1)."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Case M3DY, with an injection in area 5, was characterized by a complete absence of retrogradely labelled neurons in EC, TP, and PRC. In this case, only occasional neurons were found in area TFl."
@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Comments: No label was detected in this case

@Injections.Citation: "Tracer injections were located in somatosensory association area 5 (M3DY) and at different rostrocaudal and mediolateral levels of the inferior parietal lobe area 7 (M3FB, M2DY, and M2FB) (Fig. 2 and Table 1)."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Cases with injections in area 7 resulted in retrograde labelling ranging from moderate to low in EC, TP, and PRC, while it was high in PPH. Injections located more ventrally in area 7 resulted in an overall higher density of label compared to more dorsal injections (Fig. 11A–C). The distribution of retrogradely labelled neurons in a representative case (M2FB) can be seen in Fig. 10. In all cases, EC displayed neuronal labelling in layer V, where it formed a band of label located caudal and lateral (from EI to ECL). Areas 36pm and 36pl of the temporal pole contained a moderate to low density of labelled neurons in cases with the most ventrally placed injections in area 7 (M3FB and M2FB, Fig. 10A). PRC displayed low density of labelled cells in layers V and VI of the caudal portion of areas 35, 36r, and 36c (Fig. 11A and B). Both the amount and the mediolateral extent of the neuronal labelling increased in layer V of area 36c (see two-dimensional map in Fig. 11A and B). In contrast, areas TFl and THc of PPH had heavy labelling after injections in area 7. The highest density of retrograde label was found in layers V and VI, and to a lesser extent in layer III of area TFl, although TFm also displayed labelled neurons (mostly in layer V). Retrograde label was comparatively much lower in area TH. Labelled neurons were found primarily in layer V of area THc."

publication.title: Cortical efferents of the entorhinal cortex and the adjacent parahippocampal region in the monkey (Macaca fascicularis)
publication.abstract: "Entorhinal cortex (EC) relays information from the hippocampus to the cerebral cortex. The origin of this entorhino-cortical pathway was studied semiquantitatively and topographically with the use of 23 retrograde tracer injections in cortical areas of the frontal, temporal, and parietal lobes of the monkey. To assess possible alternative, parallel pathways, the parahippocampal region, comprised of temporal pole (TP), perirhinal (PRC), and posterior parahippocampal cortices (PPH), was included in the study. The majority of the cortical areas receive convergent projections from EC and the parahippocampal region. Strong EC layer V output is directed to temporal pole, medial frontal and orbitofrontal cortices, and the rostral part of the polysensory area of the superior temporal sulcus (sts). Moderate EC output is directed to the caudal superior temporal gyrus, area TE, and parietal cortex, and little to none to the lateral frontal cortex. With the exception of the projection to the medial frontal cortex, output from TP, PRC, and PPH surpassed that from EC, although with regional differences. TP layers II–III, V–VI project strongly to all areas injected except parietal cortex and caudal superior temporal gyrus, while PRC layers III/V–VI send strong projections to rostral parts of area TE and sts. PPH layers III/V–VI project heavily to parietal cortex and caudal superior temporal gyrus. These results suggest that the medial temporal output is primarily organized hierarchically, but at the same time, it has multiple exits of information. These parallel, alternative routes may influence local circuitry in the cerebral cortex and participate in the consolidation of declarative memory."
